sound

Class SoundUpload

  • java.lang.Object
    • sound.SoundUpload

  • public class SoundUpload
extends java.lang.Object
    Loads all sound files for a directory. For each directory there exists only one instance of SoundUpload as determined by the getInstance method. For an example of how to use SoundUpload see playSound in SimpleObject
    Version:
    1.0 Works for MIDI and WAV files.
    Author:
    Brian Nakayama
    See Also:
    SimpleObject

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.io.File getFile()
      Get the file used to construct this instance.
      static SoundUpload getInstance(java.io.File f)
      Creates an instance of SoundUpload if one doesn't exist for the file f.
      Sound getSound(java.lang.String fileName)
      Get a sound file

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SoundUpload getInstance(java.io.File f)
        Creates an instance of SoundUpload if one doesn't exist for the file f. If an instance already exists, this method will return that instance. Every time an instance is created all of the sound files in the directory passed in will be uploaded.
        Parameters:
        f - The directory containing sound files. (*.wav, *.midi)
        Returns:
        An instance of SoundUpload

      • getSound

        public Sound getSound(java.lang.String fileName)
        Get a sound file
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file name, not including any directories or the full path.
        Returns:
        The sound if it exists.

      • getFile

        public java.io.File getFile()
        Get the file used to construct this instance.
        Returns:
        The directory
